thread.title: NASA to reveal major 'discovery beyond our planet' THIS WEEK
thread.title_full: NASA to reveal major 'discovery beyond our planet' THIS WEEK

title: NASA to reveal major 'discovery beyond our planet' THIS WEEK
text:
NEW LIFE: Scientists believe exoplanets could one day host human life 
Space boffins hope these planets could one day support human colonies. 
Last year NASA announced it had found nine Earth-like planets and they could contain life . 
The US space agency will host the event at its Washington HQ at 1pm EST (6pm UK time) on Wednesday. 
The news event can be viewed live on NASA’s TV station and website. The world from space Friday, 8th April 2016 Astronauts, like Kjell Lindgren and Brit Tim Peake, share incredible photographs taken from space. London, New York and California alongside amazing natural landscapes across our Earth are seen from 250 miles above in Space. 1 / 24 Tim Peake - '44 laps around the sun & about 1775 around Earth' “NASA will hold a news conference at 1 p.m. EST Wednesday, Feb. 22” NASA 
World leading scientists and astronomers will be in attendance. 
Thomas Zurbuchen, of NASA’s Science Mission Directorate, and Michael Gillon, astronomer at the University of Liege in Belgium, will be among them. 
A Reddit AMA, or ask me anything, session will be held after the announcement. Related articles
